text: Pizza is cooked ahead and slices are reheated when you order.  Tasteless and expensive. $7 for cheese slice and $8 with topping.

I ordered one slice of pepperoni pizza and had to wait 30 minutes to get it. When I finally got it, it was cold and it tasted cheap. I would have understood if it took 30 minutes for a hot slice, but why was it so cold? I noticed that I wasn't the only one with this problem as there were people asking for refunds.

So if you're ever at Caesar's Palace and you're hungry, walk right past Difara. You're not missing out on anything

Pizza was incredible, staff was courteous and helpful! Visited the place a few times and tried their grandma and spinach pizza- delicious! Chicken delight pizza is AMAZING, tasty crust, seasoned perfectly. Quality ingredients. Chef Joey came out to see if we were enjoying the food and offered us to try different pizzas (including the spinach) and when we did we were not disappointed! Will be back soon!

I see a lot of negativity and everyone is entitled to there opinion but this is a New York stable that unfortunately is not getting the love that it deserves mayb bc the the fact thee Dom is not at at this location. Anyways hopefully this place can live up to the OG one. I honestly think this location has a simple classic pizza nothing over the top. They should have gave it more an authentic feel bc everyone is just bashing on something they have no clue about. Di fara in New York is the best period but this on has a lot to live up. So owners live up to the name for everyone's sake! Btw even at this location the pizza is still the best to me
Excellent service. Pizza was amazing. Chef Joseph is awesome! Meat lovers is something I would definitely recommend to anyone.
20min wait for a slice of pizza?? and it came out burnt and very salty(( Very disappointing and overpriced. Definitely not recommend!

Unexpectedly saw Di Fara's as we were searching for a quick bite to eat at Caesar's Palace since another restaurant we wanted to go to was closed for the night. Having gone to the original Di Fara's in Brooklyn, I can't say this was the best pizza as it was nowhere near as comparable as the fresh slice I had made in Brooklyn (I still think the pizza I had there was the best I've ever had). Although this is a small food court version of the original location, I understand that they don't make the pizzas on the spot- instead, they have pre-made pizzas that they will reheat for you. The pizza was still good, especially because we were hungry, but the only part that was similar to the original location was that they used the same pepperoni. I wouldn't go back unless most of the other places at Caesar's were closed.
$8 for a pizza that tastes like cardboard? No selection. Seriously who prefers a mushroom pizza over hawiian? Get it together guys... Not coming back here...

For some reason my last review was taken down.  Only the bad reviews make it on here. I think the pizza is great and people are complaining about the price and not the quality.  My favorite slice is the meat lovers!
First time I went to a pizza place and got told flat out we don't have any pepperoni pizza.  Not even an offer... we can make it in x minutes if you would like to wait.

Tasted like pizza from elementary school. Way over priced. Very disappointed. The service was friendly and that's the only reason why I would give 1 star. Cesar salad was a tad bit soggy,  maybe the dressing should be served on the side. If you decide to eat here, be ready to shell out some money.  $36 for 2 combo meals that left us with major heartburn and I got a major stomach ache.....  Waste of money.... and had to make a trip to Walgreens....
Pizza is pretty decent for food court fare. Service is very slow and seemingly unsure how to have people line up. Better options in the food court. Won't be coming back.

I've been to the original in my native Brooklyn many times and was excited to see this at Caesars. As soon as I saw the pre-made pizza I knew it couldn't be great. My slice of cheese pizza was not hot enough so I returned it. No problem. The gal tossed mine in the trash and produced a new one. And you know what? It had the same flavor. It couldn't be the same as a pie fresh out of the oven but it had good crust and beat any food court pizza by a mile.

Ok, so it's a food court... so you expect food court food.  This exceeded food court by a long shot.  They have a chef on site and they know their stuff.... not just a little, like a lot.  Really tasty and very easy to get (it's a food court after all).  Would go back for a snack in an instant.

Super friendly staff.  They have the water treated or shipped in from Brooklyn, so the crust is just like the original location in Brooklyn.  Regular cheese pizza is the way to go.  Don't kid your pizza up with a bunch of toppings.  That's amateurish for NY pizza.  Ordered a whole pie for the group so it was perfectly fresh, etc.

Yeah, it's expensive for "food court pizza" but it's a lot better and you're in Vegas.  Go to another city if the markup here in town isn't something you can handle without it ruining your experience.

I had an excellent slice of old school NY Style cheese pizza from Difara.  It was just the right amount of cheese to sauce.  Yum!  Pizza was fresh and hot, they've got it down behind the counter. I'll be back for sure.

This place is fine. Not sure what people are really expecting to get out in the middle of the desert, at a food court that is, but hey, everyone's entitled to their own opinion. Ended up getting a slice for like 7 bucks after using my Total Rewards card for a dollar discount. Got the meal lovers one. It was pretty small but hey, did the trick. I'm sure there's better pizza around, but when you need quick food, this is just fine.

Had the mushroom slice of pizza- a bit of heaven on earth!  My piece may have been sitting out for a while, so my only regret is not asking for a fresh slice.  Would have been a five star review if not for that and the slightly rude order taker (rolled her eyes one too many times when we'd ask questions).

Di Fara's name is renowned as the maker one of the best pizzas in the U.S. (according to an MSN annual survey). To expand from its roots is risky, but they tried to do so in Las Vegas. Major fail. It's impossible to measure up to the original. 

If you tried it on a blind taste test and didn't know it was connected to Di Fara's of Brooklyn, you'd probably think more of it. It's a good pizza, but it's just not Di Fara's good. And for $7.24 for a slice of cheese pizza, it had better be amazing.

Pizza is great but service is crap. waited 10-15 min with 4 ppl in front of me to order a slice! of pizza then another 10-15 to get it. then u have to go search for water and napkins in the food park. not to mention trying to find a place to sit and eat the 7 yes 7 dollar slice of just peperoni pizza. no common sense is practiced here.
Not a very good New York style pizza. The reviews for the New York restaurant has a 4 star rating. What happen here.

This is one of the best pizza joints in Vegas besides Dom's and you know what's even better? It closes really late. The original place is of coarse the
" Creme de la Creme" in Brooklynn. So, when I'm in either location I buy more than one. Trust me and get yourself one or maybe two? Don't waste your money on getting the just a slice. Don't be cheap and spend the dough because you're going to wish you did. It's a little expensive, there will be a wait and consider yourself lucky because if you were in Brooklynn right now you'd have to wait 2hrs. Yeah, that's what I said but that's the OG, man!!!

I'm writing this review from Los Angeles, I'm not getting the deal that they've got running right now if you yelp. If you're reading this right now get on it and ask them what that deal is all about.

"Sending pizza kisses to the creator Mr. DeMarco back in Brooklynn. They'll never make it as good as you ( always made by him personally) but it will have to do for Vegas trips.

I'll love you and your pizza till the day I die, you are the "GODFATHER of PIZZA" of all TIME! Please continue the tradition!!!

It's a tiny bit expensive, but reliable.  FYI, Di Fara tastes dramatically better and different than this.  So don't judge Di Fara based on this.  Go to Brooklyn, make a trip out of it. It's eccentric and old school--and so worth it.  

Having tasted the real thing and having such fond memories of the Brooklyn shop--it is a bit hard to look at this without resentment. But if I ignore the name, the pizza is reliable and only slightly overpriced in the way one would expect for Caesar's food court.

This seriously reminds me of the worst pizza I had in Manhattan NYC. The cheese slices are sickeningly greasy so much that it soaks thought the crust. The crust when not saturated with grease is uninspired and tasteless. Stay far away if you like pizza.

Maybe everyone's issue is because they get reheated slices. 

We got two whole plies and wow  they delicious. I don't know how I'm going to goto Caesars and not get a whole pie. 

I've never had the real di faro pizza in Brooklyn but maybe ignorance is bliss.  This pizza is delicious. It's expensive and over priced like almost everything else in Caesars but it's truly delicious.  

I bought tickets for Celine dion for next month and I already know what we are having for dinner. Luckily the food court is close to the parking garage and I can leave the left over in the car.  

Everyone's bad reviews seems like they are from people who bought slices. We got whole pies and I loved it.  I'm very critical of pizza and this is one of my favorites in Vegas.

Not sure why I had any positive expectations, but this was notably bad. $12.71 for a slice and bottle of water. So be it. But the slice was a doughy, overly cheesy, undersauced mess. Staff were polite, but other than the name, this couldn't taste more like any other chain pizza.

Was hungry and decided to give it a try. Sadly, I wasn't a fan. It was just sub-par. It was very heavily garlicky. Barely any pepperoni on a pepperoni  pizza. Service was very good and friendly. But if I had a choice, I'd head to Secret Pizza at the Cosmo for some better NY style pizza.

I agree with everybody else.  It is pricey being at Caesars so I will just rate food.  Friendly service but food fell flat, literally.  Pizza was greasy and floppy.  It looked like it had been sitting there forever.  They throw some basil on top to make it look better, lol.  No flavor.  The side Caesar salad I got to go with it was soggy. Nothing memorable.  Heck as I write this two weeks later, I don't remember much about it except that I would not go back.

Pizza just ok. Being a RI native not worth the hype.  Pizza just okay.  The bone totally not worth it. Caesar salad let's  just pizza was better. Don't  wanna say it was bad, just not good.  So let's  talk about bad. Fed the garlic  knots to my dogs...they loved them....just saying. I on the other hand fed them to the dogs. Will I go back... ABSOLUTELY  NOT! For the money.....so not worth it. $9 for a slice of  pepperoni pizza I am a total  sucker!!!!
Pretty terrible. Pizza was Hella greasy and mediocre. Took a while to make and the soda machine was gross.

This is the worst pizza I have ever tasted in my entire life. It is inside the ceasers palace casino food court and there was a very long line. 

We waited 15 minutes for our ONE pizza slice, and it just seemed really unorganized in the kitchen for a fast food joint. 
I got so fed up when I saw whole pizzas come out on the display case when my slice still wasn't served... so I went to the register and complained and that was the only time they remembered my order.

It was $9 for ONE slice of pizza!!!

The wait was not worth it, the cheese was really cheap quality that it was sliding off the dough the moment we bit into it. There were blotches of red thick oil on the cheese it was disguisting. The pepperoni was saltier than the cheap pizza you grab at 7 eleven.
Priscilla and Ramon provided great service. This is great for late night snacks or a quick lunch. Try the garlic knots and slice of sausage pizza.

One slice of the "house specialty" pepperoni pizza (with a  bit of basil) will run you $8. Comparing Strip slices and prices, Secret Pizza is better (and cheaper). I found the crust a bit plain and dry, but the pepperoni was good and I liked that basil was included. But this was not as good as I expected, given the hype. I have to assume their Brooklyn location is either significantly better, or better-received because the prices are lower.

As a New Yorker who's waited in Di Fara Pizza's Brooklyn location for an hour and a half (or longer) and not regretting it, i was shocked at how bad the Las Vegas slice was. The sauce,  crust, and cheese were all different (to the slice's detriment). The only similarity was the fresh basil on the pizza. Not only was the pizza it mediocre, it's overpriced. There's lots of better slices in Vegas much cheaper and Di Fara should be embarrassed for besmirching their brand.
I should have read some of the reviews before I went here.  Overpriced pizza that is open late at night.  Enough said.  Your money is better spent elsewhere.
I tried this place late at night. I was disappointed in the pizza. It was sitting for a long time.

Late post: I was there right after 4th of July for a conference. I ordered the Lasagna & it was one of the best I ever had. Its a large portion that 2 people can eat. It was so tasty & filling. It came with 2 buttered rolls & a drink for about $19.  So worth the purchase.

This is probably the worst pizza I've ever had in my life. First of all, I cannot believe they are selling reheated pizza by the slice for $8. And you still have to wait 15 min or so to get it. This is not the really bad part though.

The pizza is HORRIBLE. It is a complete insult to the Di Fara name!!! I cannot believe people who have never had the privilege of tasting pizza made by Dom DeMarco are walking around living life thinking "this is di Fara pizza" No. No. No!!!

The real Di Fara in Midwood Brooklyn, NY is the best pizza I've ever had in my life. So please everyone, next time you're in New York, take the train to Brooklyn (or a $20 uber ride like I did) and go taste the real deal!!! This is NOT DI FARA PIZZA. 

I cannot believe his son opened up this place, used his dad's legendary name to sell Sbarro food court pizza and charges an arm and leg for it. Disgusting!
Wow!  The absolute worst pizza I've ever had!!!  Staff was friendly but come the "F" on! I can't believe it's not butter/pizza. Very disappointed in this place.

In Vegas for Memorial Day weekend! Checked out Omnia nightclub, had a blast! Came to the food court an fell in love with the NY style pizza here at difara!  Had a slice an decided I had to take a box of pepperoni pizza to my room. Will definitely be back before the long weekend is over!

Hard choosing a place to eat when you're on the strip with young kids. You can't go wrong with pizza (though not my personal first choice.) Was walking through Caesars and saw DiFara. Ordered a whole meat pizza for the family. Honestly the BEST food court or restaurant quality pizza I've tasted. Worth a try whether you are looking for something fast or just plain delicious pizza!

I had a couple of slices yesterday and they were both great.  The pepperoni slice was hot and crispy crust.  The mushroom was not what I expected but in a good way.  I've never been to the joint in Brooklyn but this place is fine with me!

I sat in front of the bartender for 30 minutes. Apparently my money isn't good enough. He kept telling me he'd be right with me and I couldn't get a beer. For 30 freaking minutes ai sat there thirsty as he kept having conversation with other people and I couldn't get a single beer.
Great Pizza!cant get it out of my mind . can't wait to go back. you have to try the meat lovers pizza simply delicious.

The pizza here definitely does not hold a candle to the legendary pies served in Brooklyn because there is no Dom DeMarco in the kitchen, but it's still loads better than the average food court Italian. A slice runs around $8, but keep in mind that a single slice cut in half could easily feed two petite Asian girls before clubbing at Omnia. True story!

Mm well let's start with the fact that the people working there cared more about laughing it up together then they did about doing their job. Second, is this even pizza? Mine was literally so soggy. Like it was dipped in water before they gave it to me. Third, are they not required to heat up the pizza? They slapped two pizzas ON TOP OF EACH OTHER in my to-go box. All of that for 18 bucks? No that's ridiculous. I understand location and having to charge a large amount because of it but in that event have better quality products and workers. They should realize that just because most of the customers are drunk doesn't mean they all are. NEVER again. And I live in Vegas.

I came to Di Fara's sometime in the middle of the night when I was quite inebriated. It explains why I didn't mind so much when I got burnt garlic knots and thin, dry pizza that tasted a lot like sawdust. 

Thankfully, I can't remember much more except the first disappointing bite and everything else gets much more hazy which I consider a blessing. Some things are best forgotten...like Di Fara's food.

I was so excited to see Di Fara, my absolute favorite pizzeria in NYC, in LA! It seemed too good to be true... and it was.

I'm not sure if this is actually owned by the same Di Fara in Brooklyn, but it definitely wasn't the same high quality thin crust pizza. It was decent for late-night food-court food, but not up to par. 

Both the Meat Lovers and the Plain were quite oily and didn't have that perfect thin crust of the Di Fara I know. The sauce wasn't as fresh, and the cheese was matted and thick. Again, it was fine for a late night snack, but nothing to go out of your way for!

21 bucks for two slices and a beer. 

If it was magnificent, I'd be happy paying that price and chalk it up to Vegas pricing. However, the pizza was average at best, and wasn't even all that fresh. 

You're better off saving five bucks and getting random pizza from wherever, or spending that money on Wolfgang Puck's creations 100 feet away.

Against my better judgment I decided to give this place a try. I really should have listened to the reviews I read. There was only 1 person ahead of me ordering. Still waited almost 10 minutes just to put my order in.  About $8 for a decently large slice of pepperoni pizza, not too bad. They warm up the pizza once you order it. So it's been sitting out there for God knows how long.  My pizza came out with this burnt charcoal taste to it. Gross. Never again.

The pizza here is pretty good. I enjoyed the veggie slice. It's a Brooklyn style pizza with fresh tomato slices. I sprinkle chili peppers on the extra large slice for an added kick.

For about $15, I got the combo slice with medium fountain drink. You also get two garlic  knots..They're tasty. For dipping, you get a small cup of spicy tomato dip..so good. 

The service is fast and friendly. A good stop for pizza at the Caesar's Palace food court...near the entrance before leaving the casino floor and into the Forum Shops.

Above average Brooklyn-style pizza joint. Enjoyed my slice so much that I came back later and got an entire PIE! 

Impressive flop, you will need to adjust grip during the slice. Enjoyed the thinner type crust, but wasn't like cracker-thin, maintaining its hide. If you're familiar with Ninja Turtles, it looked like the pizza they would eat, with premium FLOP !

Listen, you can't go wrong here. They have all kinds of house specialty pizzas that looked interesting. On debut pizza outings, cheese or pepperoni standard topping as a first-time customer. For a basic cheese pizza, Difarra makes your slice worthwhile. Sprinkled parsley glitters the pie and compliments the impeccable sauce distribution.

***With wallet-buster options in the surrounding area, Difara's stands out from the rest of the pack. Late night or afternoon snack, this pizza, I will NOT turn down.***

Been here a coupe of times. Love coming here and grabbing a slice for a snack. Meatballs are on point. I'm gonna have them out the meatballs on my pie next time. When I was super hungry one day I got the chicken parm sub. Wow. Friggin huge! Legendary pizza place in a casino food court. Thanks Vegas.

Updated 3/18/2015:  Pizza was soggy and old, I even asked for crispy.  Way too much cheese now.  This place is going downhill fast.  Was super good the first week it opened, but overtime I have been since it goes down a star.  This last time was just plan no good, I had to throw my 2nd slice out, because there was no way to hold it!  Ugh!  If Dom saw what was happening here they would close it down.

From 1/18.2015 Best New York Pizza in Las Vegas.   If your in Vegas and want a slice, this is where you need to come.  Yes it's on the strip and in Caesars so expect to pay a premium.  But bring your total rewards card and get a significant discount.   They import the water from NEW YORK people.    Yeah, it's not Dom making it, but a trip to NY and a wait of at least an hour costs a lot more.

Plain cheese is the way to go! I've had both the square Sicilian pizza and the traditional circle pizza. What makes this pizza so good is the fresh ingredients. I love the fresh basil on each slice. The food court staff is exceptionally friendly and even follow-up with drink refills etc once you are seated.

Honestly no idea how people can rate this pizza poorly. Had the white pizza and garlic knots and they were top notch.  Literally one of the best of its kind I've had, if not the best. 

Service was slow, but it was worth it. 

P.S.  To those of you complaining that food court pizza inside of a casino food court is expensive, what planet were you born on? Everything is expensive inside of these casinos. Well, anything that doesn't get you drunk enough to give away your money at casinos anyway.

Came late on a Friday night, about 10pm. Pizza? Well, it's alright. Expected but didn't expect the $8 per slice price. My slice was burnt to a crisp, my husband's wasn't. Both pieces combined had less than 4 slices of pepperoni. That's Brooklyn Style according to the cashier. No biggie. There's plenty more pizza in the Palace. (Or the strip. Whatever.)

Decent late night spot if you need to grab something quick to eat after leaving Omnia. They only had a few options if you're ordering by the slice (Meat Lovers, Pepperoni, or Cheese) and I opted for a Slice of Cheese Pizza ($6.99). There was no line when I went around 2am, and it took only a few minutes for them to warm up my slice. I thought there could've been more cheese, but it was fine. Just make sure you eat it quickly since the crust gets hard/crunchy very quickly.
Good place to grab a slice and go! Pricier then I had expected - $15 for two slices and a drink seems steep. But decent pizza for sure

Needed a quick bite before a concert at Caesar's Palace.  Saw Di Fara and decided to pick up a couple of slices of pizza, a soda, and garlic knots for around $20.  

This spot had the longest line in the food court but moved rather quickly.  The pizza was honestly nothing special.  It definitely was foldable, not too oily, probably perfect for a drunken night.  Otherwise, not necessarily an amazing Vegas dinner.  Oh, and the garlic knots just weren't garlicky enough although they were soft and served with a side of decent tomato sauce.

Not enough greatness for a return.  2 stars.
Pizza is good but when compared to the original I feel it falls short but not bad was worth a shot
Pretty average pizza but the price is a much higher than it should be.

I'm pretty sure the second I saw my slice go into the TurboChef microwave the pizza gods shamed this place. While the Brooklyn location might be the best in NYC, the DiFara here is not even close.  Save your money and go somewhere else.
Best pizza ever and I loved the garlic knots it was really crowed but what can you expect being in Cesar's palace right!!!! Which they had another location in north Las Vegas

For what it is, it's okay. Not flavorful by any means and overpriced. 23 bucks for a 2 piece combo that came with a drink plus another drink. The soda machine was leaky on multiple sodas. And in addition to all of this the attendant cleaning  the area in mid bite as I put down my pizza to get a drink cleaned our table taking the plates with my half eaten slice with her. When she realized, she said oh were you not done and of course I was then. SKIP.
A late night snack in Vegas that doesn't cost you an arm and a leg, he'll yeah. It's great!

Prices were pretty crazy for a slice of pizza about $8 for plain cheese, but the pizza was pretty good for something quick. They are open later than most places on the strip, so that was great. Most restaurants close at 11PM.

Delicious pizza! Ordered a whole pie($30) for 4 ppl. So good, dont get the bad reviews, maybe cause they made our to order it was hotter, tastier etc. Anyway the staff was great and you cant go wrong feeding 4 ppl for 30 bucks in CP.

Have them make it to order

Not even close to the original except in price. $6.99 for a reheated, blandly flavored slice with a cardboardy crust--before the Caesars reward card discount. You can't expect artisan pizza in a food court setting. Tempted, however, to try Graeter's ice cream across the way.
This ain't Brooklyn for sure. But man can quality just drop so damn far. Over priced for crap pizza in a food court that makes you hate yourself after. Do better with yourself.
Awful pizza and overpriced! Ordered a slice of plain pizza, was bland and certainly not worth the $7.50 they charge for One Slice!

A disappointment to the iconic Brooklyn pizzeria Di Fara...but then again, I'm ordering it from a food court in Nevada. 

"I ordered some spaghetti with marinara sauce and I got egg noodles and ketchup." - Henry Hill

Overall, we were not impressed with the pizza. We waited for about 15 mins in line for two slices and were only the third in the line. It took about 30 mins to get the two slices and it tasted like it was leftover from the night before and than nuked in the microwave.

This place is dragging down the forum food court.

I ate here twice, and was surprised and disappointed each time.

Lunch during a busy rush.
I'm not sure anyone working had ever hustled, or worked a fast service there. We all watched in awe as they clumsily bumped around getting orders out. Plating, unplating, plating again. Snipping basil (nice fresh touch, but how about pre chopping what you need for the next 15 minutes+ ?), and generally confused. I waited forever and a day, and ended up burning my mouth because I was eating so fast....and still 10 minutes late back to my class upstairs.

Afternoon snack when there was no line.
Inattentive cashiers more focused on chatting with each other. Way too long of a wait, considering nothing else was going on, again clumsily plating, unplating, replaying the food. Sent my tiny ti go snack order in a HUGE pizza box. Embarassingly large. The garlic bread knots were kinda cold in the center. Ugh.
As a native New Yorker, skip it.  $7 or $8 for a slice.  Absolutely unheard of.  If you want pizza from Di Fara, go to Dom DeMarco's in Summerlin.  Large 18" pie is about $18.
If you've been to the original DiFara's in Brooklyn, then don't even bother with this location. The pizza tastes nothing like the original DiFara's. Very very disappointing.

Stopped in the Caesar's Palace food court for a quick light snack before the legit 4 and half hour weight for the Casino Buffet and ordered up Di Fara's Greek salad. 

Salad was like $10 and decent meal sized portion. Loved the spicy peppers inside, feta was great, nice amount of Kalamata olives - it was actually surprisingly good for food court food. Plus, if you go to this food court this is one of your only vegetarian meal options as the actual salad restaurant offers ZERO vegetarian options. 

I didn't get the pizza here but it looked p good and you can order up and entire pizza for your crew for around $32 and save you money for those casino games.

You're better off flying to New York, taking the train to Brooklyn, and waiting a few hours for the real DiFara.

Instead of a pie made fresh by the man Dom Demarco himself, this is food court pizza heated up by a bunch of teenagers.

To add insult to injury, a slice of the pepperoni costs $8 (!). It is in a food court after all, so you can't expect much, but it's sad to see the respected name sullied so (I'm still not on the DiFara bandwagon myself, but even the slices I've tried from the Brooklyn one are significantly better than this).

Maybe get a sandwich or a Smashburger instead.

Stopped in here late one evening after visiting various spots and wanted to grab something to eat and keep me going. There was a line of people here ordering slices so I fell in line.
Ordered their two slice special. One pepperoni, one mushroom, and a fountain drink. $20. Some special. What can I say, it's Vegas prices.
Pizza was only OK. The mushroom slice was the better of the two.
Di Fara is quite a famous name in the pizza biz out of N.Y. It's obvious here that Caesar's bought the name. I hope the old man got a bundle.

You can taste the history and the love of Di Fara Pizza in Brooklyn.   That same history and love is NOT here.  I visited Brooklyn last week and went to the famous Di Fara. When I was there, Dom de Marco himself was putting the pies together.  That was just amazing. 

Here in Las Vegas, the crust is missing the love. It's thicker and chewy and tastes like any pizzatown USA.  For food court pizza, it's ok. It's the only choice you have for pizza. The toppings are good though. That's why the 3 stars and not 2. What makes the pizza though is the right amount of toppings with the world famous crust and this pizza doesn't hit that mark.

I had never tried the OG Di Fara's so I'm not sure how it compares but I found it it be quite appetizing. I tried the mushroom slice which was simple but delicious. They use oil on their pizzas which was different put it worked well with the crust, cheese, and mushrooms. The price was high but it matched everything in Caesar's Palace so it's understandable. I didn't try anything else off the menu, but speaking for the mushroom slice, I'd eat it again.

One slice of pizza is approximately $8 and it's not the same pizza served at Dom DeMarco's in Summerlin. This pizza is thin, soggy, and not particularly tasty-- I'd argue that Costco pizza is better quality. It's also insanely expensive because it's located inside a casino.

If you're hungry and absolutely need to eat inside Caesar's Palace without breaking your wallet, Earl of Sandwich next door in this same food court serves up filling sandwiches at approximately $10. Whenever we're at this food court, that's our go-to until we can get real food outside the casino. In short-- pass on Di Fara Pizza and go straight to Dom DeMarco's in Summerlin instead to get the real deal (order the Di Fara there).

The service here was so bad today I came out of  retirement of writing reviews just so management and staff can stumble upon this. I would talk to them personally but the lack of concern of the staff just made me want to get out of there. 

Ordered a whole meat lovers pizza and Register girl said it would be 15mins. I paid for the pizza, received a little buzzer to notify when the order's ready, and sat with my table waiting. 25 minutes later I was 
Still waiting. I go up to the counter and same lady ask me for order. I reminded her of my current order, and she seemed confused like she doesn't know a thing about it. She turns around n talks to her other co-workers and everyone seemed puzzled. Then they look around and realized my pizza has been ready, unsliced and unboxed just sitting there. Honestly, if my group and I weren't starving, I would have returned their pizza. Worse part, no sorry or any sign of any concern for their customer. Lady behind the counter said "it's coming you can pick it up on the next counter" and guy that handed me my pizza had nothing to say either! So disappointed at their service.

The pizza itself was filling with each individual slice can feed 1-2 ppl. However, it was super greasy, the toppings were falling off, and tad saltier than it should be, even for a meat lover. 

Get it together... You're in the business to please!

Chef Joseph is amazing!! He goes above an beyond with his customer service. Oh and the pizza is super good too!! Fair price for being located in a hotel. I recommend getting a full pizza and sharing it with friends!
Overall- nasty. Cesar salad was soggy and the dressing tasted watered down. Pepperoni pizza was soggy and oily and there was very little cheese on it. Will not be back.

This pizza is pretty darned good! Really, it is! 

I wasn't expecting much at all and thank goodness I hadn't looked at Yelp before purchasing because this pie is worth more than 2 1/2 stars. 

We had 1 slices of meat lovers pizza and a drink (looked like a medium) for $18.43 after tax. The slices were huge and topped with way too much meat to complain. The sausage was spicy like I like it.  They also topped it with basil which was a nice touch.  This place satisfied my pizza cravings and made me happy. 

I would definitely try this place again.

They had a huge line and we were walking on the strip for awhile and felt hungry. We stood in line as they sold their last slices and refused to make fresh ones and just reheated the ones already out on display. It was actually really satisfying and delicious. We were drinking a lot do it helped sober us up as we kept gambling. This place makes Vegas fun lol! It's these places that you remember after a good time. We were winning at the slots as we walked the strip and time just passed by so quickly. This place was our winning meal. Lol I requested for Late checkout and we will never forget this place. Haha

I just stopped after work at Difarra pizzeria inside The forum Food court at Caesars Palace I was looking for something different for dinner I brought The meat Lovers the pizza was so delicious everything fresh and the cook Gustavo take care all the orders and deliver on time Great service Good Food

Sorry DiFara Brooklyn , but you shouldnt lend your name to a below average pizza joint in Vegas. 
No flavor at the top nor at the base !

Been here a couple of times and really liked the pizza. Today, when I arrived, I was second in line. I ordered one slice of cheese pizza. It took more than 10 min to get my one slice, and no basil on my slice (which had always been a topping on a plain cheese slice in past). Disappointing.

Pizza is A-OK and the toppings were surprisingly generous for being in the middle of the casino floor. Great spot for late-night eats, located in the Caesar's food court - it's perfect if you are just leaving Omnia and cannot be bothered to walk far. 

Rolled up around 2 or 3 AM - really long line, but it moved fast. You may order by the slice or pie.We ordered a full pie ($29), half mushroom & half pepperoni. The wait for them to make it was only about ten minutes, which was really nice considering how busy they were. 

Now onto the pizza - I'm a fan of greasy deep dish but pizza is always a good choice. Their crust is nothing to write home about and a little floury tasting. The cheese had a decent "cheese pull" but there could've been more. As mentioned, there were a whole lotta mushroom and pepperoni (on their respective sides, of course). Every bite was accompanied with some topping and I never just got a full bite of cheese. 

This place is great for late-night (especially if you're in or very close to Caesars). But I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.

Great sauce! But over priced food! 
Cost me $40 to feed 5 people mediocre food. Little disappointed. Seating is a hot commodity!

Pizza by the slice.  Okay if in a pinch.  It would have better if it was fresh. After it came out of the oven, it was like cardboard.  They have about a dozen cold pizzas waiting to be reheated.  On the plus side, the employees are really nice.
Food is okay, service is terrible. I waited 20 mins to get pasta that was premade and scooped up right in front of me....

Di fara pizza is the best pizza I've had in a long time I had the combination pizza and it was great the staff is very friendly the new chef by the name ro really brought up the place it looks neater and the food tastes great worth going to really recommend di fara pizza

For food court pizza, this was pretty good. I loved that the pepperoni pizza came with fresh basil leaves: it was like a small taste of real Italian pizza! This pizza is greasy and far from high quality, but the flavors of the sauce and basil were prominent enough to bring the quality of the pizza up. 

What I didn't like is that the service and the process for serving the pizza was pretty slow and seemed rather inefficient. If you're nearby and in need for some pizza, this isn't a terrible choice.
Embarrassing version of the original. Not much more to say. Overpriced, low quality and no pride compared to the original

I really liked my cheese slice. Might have something to do with the fact I hadn't ate or slept in 24 hours but I wanted to have this pizza multiple times during our stay and didn't get a chance to have it again so I would go back. Some people said it wasn't good if it had been sitting too long. Mine was fresh though. Also I have a feeling  if you sit in the bar side instead of the food court side it could get you a fresher slice. If you're staying at the forum tower might as well keep your cup so you can reuse it for free at the soda fountain during your stay. Is that ghetto ?
Pretty good thin crust pizza for a food court. Just like a true ny pizza you got to pinch the edges of the crust together to eat it.
OuThe bread knots are amazing. 3 for $6. You will not be disaoppointed. Pizza is $8 a slice. You make the call.
Late night pizza at Di Fara at Forum food court. Did I say huge!!! Portions meat lovers is the best slice for me. Great food and service!!

Very poor service. I order the meat lovers after leaving omnia. Three people were served ahead of me. Then after I complained the girl grabbed a pizza slice that she said was ready. It was cold. I was starving so I ate it just get something in my stomach.  Even hot, I don't think it would be that great. Overpriced for what you get. Very much on par with a mall Sabaros. Don't waste your time if you are looking for decent pizza.

Yeah this was ok. A decent option in the food hall. We should've gone with earl or halal guys though. The pizza is expensive for what you get and it was over cooked and the toppings were just ok in flavor. We would only come back if we had to have pizza. The garlic knots didn't have any flavor even with the sauce.
Total ripoff. $5.50 for an 11.5 ounce Perrier. Mediocre slice of cheese pizza for over $7. Crazy.

Late night snack. This is your place. The pizza is good. I mean...it's nothing to write home about, but it gets the job done and fills your belly. It's perfect for kids that don't want to eat hamburgers or sushi. The pice is a little high, but trust me, one slice per person is enough. I had the mushroom cheese pizza and my husband ate the meat lovers. Service was typical. They warmed the pizza for you so it would be just the right temperature.
Had this for dinner after an all day conference. I was really hungry and this didn't really satisfy me. I was not really impressed, I've had better pizza at bowling alleys.

If you're looking for a $8 slice of pizza, you found the right spot! Are you looking for the most dried out, cold slice of pizza you ever had!? You again found the right spot! If you don't like any of these options, you have amazing taste and go else where.

This place is so over priced. The pizza is ok but not worth $8+ a slice. Spent about $15 with 2 garlic knots and a soda. The crazy thing is that it's not about the money, the quality of the food does not match up. If the pizza tasted better and the garlic knots weren't so dry then yeah, for sure price would be worth it. Sadly that's  not the case. And I really wanted to like this place. The Pizzeria at Circus Circus is way better in my opinion and for $20 you'll get a whole pizza

Easily the most wonderful pizza to grace this earth

Every bite is a bit of heaven in a pie

The wait is well worth it

Will go there ANY chance possible

I got the white mushroom pizza and the meat lovers pizza slices. One of each plus a fountain drink $20. Pizza was decent but not worth the $20 then if you want the whole pie it's like $35. I guess even a food court at a casino is a rip off. Suppose to be fast food and cheap but that's not the case in Vegas.

It's over seven dollars for a slice. Next day I didn't decide to get a whole pizza for $35 and it's a huge pie, one of the biggest 
Pies I've ever gotten. So I think if got few people in your party the get a whole pie it's a lot of pizza and you'll possible have cold pizza next day in your room. It's a better buy then few people buying a slice and a drink.

This used to be slice and now DI Fara and it's basically the same pizza. I still
Love the crust NY style and the white pizza is definitely the best! Prices are a little high but work that it. Best deal is 2 slices and a soda!

Holly pizza, this is absolutely the WORST pizza I have ever had. I'm not kidding, there's no way in pizza heaven anyone could make a worse pizza even if they purposely tried.  Its almost difficult to try screwing up a pizza this bad.....Don't waste a single dime on this place. Starve to death taste better. I"M DEAD SERIOUS.....I thought I was dead after the first bite. This is indeed the worst pizza I have ever brought....

CAESARS PALACE SWEEPSTAKES WINNER ADVENTURE #8: LAST MEAL

When I checked out of Caesars Palace my flight to Oakland was 3:05 PM. I had already exhausted the $600 dining credit for 3 dinners during my comped 3-night stay at Caesars Palace. I needed something to eat before I headed to the airport. I decided to come here for a quick lunch. I've heard so much about this famous pizzeria in New York. Anthony Bourdain said it's the best pizzeria in New York. However bringing the characteristic and charm of that pizzeria to Las Vegas is tricky. First at the New York location I heard there's only one person cooking the pizza - that suggests quality control. Second at the New York location people wait in long lines in anticipation of a Di Fara Pizza. At Las Vegas the tourists don't have that patience as they want their food fast. The expectations of a New York institution is too hard to fulfill at Las Vegas. Prior to my trip I thought about using the $600 dining credit for room service. One of the eateries on the room service menu is Di Fara Pizza. Because of that I had some expectations.

I ordered two slices: House Pepperoni and New York Cheese. The New York Cheese had a crispy crust. That slice of cheese pizza is unlike any other New York-style cheese pizza I ever had. I can see why a lot of people like Di Fara Pizza a lot if based only on the New York Cheese. The House Pepperoni on the other hand was a disappointment as the crust was soggy. In addition the pepperoni and cheese were dry. The House Pepperoni is the reason why I rated this eatery one star less. I do believe that if I went to the New York location my rating different than the one at Las Vegas. I'm not saying I had a bad lunch, but the expectations that this pizzeria would somewhat be par to the other restaurants I ate was due to that Di Fara Pizza was listed on the room service menu at Caesars Palace. You don't see Starbucks on a room service menu at Caesars Palace. Honestly my rating was due to the fact that I was spoiled for those 3 nights at Caesars Palace when I had 3 comped dinners.

You have already read about the wait and yes it's that bad and can be that frustrating. You have read about good the pizza is and can be worth the wait. I have to say it's that's basically true to a point. The pizza is amazing and seeing Dom making it brings you joy. However if you wait so long you're hangry, then you don't enjoy the good pie Dom puts the love into. ORDER AHEAD..WAAAAAAAAY AHEAD!!!

When hungry and buzzed at 3am at Caesars Palace, there are only two options in the food court and Smashburger can go straight to hell.  Not like eating here is a sensible decision though as it's the priciest slice in the city at more than $8 each, a whopping $18 for a 2 slice/drink combo and probably $3 for a fucking napkin.  Is Domenico "Dom" De Marco himself tossing the pies back there?

Out of sheer principle, whether it's a party of 1 or 4, the only way to go is with the whole pie (8 slices) at $29.  Hell!  I could have sold the leftover slices to the sorry assed people waiting in the same long line I just did!  We scarfed down five slices between the two of us.  My last mushroom slice was eaten for breakfast a couple of days later and wasn't bad even when sober.

There's no point in trying to compare this to the original NY location because that's just setting yourself up for disappointment.  This is about as Brooklyn as Panda Express is Chinese.  Secret Pizza is a much better call if you can make it over there.

The pizza is pretty overpriced here because it's in Caesars.
I would not recommend the pizza.  It's thin and soggy.  

If you're in the food court, you have better options like Earl's Sandwich or Phillips Seafood. 
Good luck since you're probably in Vegas reading this review.

After I ate here, I had to check on yelp and glad to see that I wasn't alone on the way this pizza is made here.  They boast that it's the best of new York but when I visited NY, I came across tons of much better pizza. I'm better off going to the Trevi restaurant in forum shops, that was good pizza and a whole pizza was 10 bucks
Slow service. Lame crust. Oil river flowing off slice even with no meat. Cheese on the mushroom pizza was flavorful.

Di Fara Pizza @caesarspalace is damn good. Another #NewYork spot representing out #west 
I miss #NewHaven and #NY #pizza so bad...so when I find something close to as good...I go fat italian! That means, I stuff my face! Caesars book, free drink tickets, and a slice. Life ain't too bad.
It's alright.  It wasn't gross but wasn't amazing either.  NY style pizza located in Cesars Palace. I liked it better when I folded the pizza making it more like a calzone.

Service was excellent both times that I've ordered a whole pie to go.  The first time, it was a short 15 minute wait, the second time I waited just 2 minutes for my meat lovers pizza as they gave me one straight out of the oven that was headed for their "pizza by the slice" counter.  The staff was friendly and polite.
Good pizza but extremely expensive.  Two slices and a drink is $18!!!!!!!!.  Granted a slice is big enough to be considered 2 slices but still.

Kinda hard to rate this place. Quite expensive pizza~~ roughly $8 for a slice and $30 for a pie. Ordering a pie somewhat justifies the cost,  as the pizza easily surpassed 20 inches imo. However, to label it as Brooklyn..it's gotta taste like a thin crust (I'm from the NYC area). Was quite disappointed since I could barely hold a slice without everything sliding off. Granted,  I ordered meat lovers, and there was a decent amount of topping on it. Verdict? I would recommend this for groups to split a pie, not so much individual sets. Also, to help it "solidify" a bit, don't eat it right when it comes out, but then who would actually wait for the pizza to cool?

We got a meat lovers pizza for 4 to share, and the yelp check-in deal of "garlic knots". It's actually one knot served with a yummy marinara sauce. It was really difficult to get it too, as it got really busy after we ordered. But nothing comes between me & my yelp check-in deal!
So I shoved tourists aside and finally was rewarded with the lowly knot. 

We all really liked the pizza, and the price (around $30) was a much better deal than getting individual slices. The toppings were plentiful, and it was better than I anticipated for a food court. They definitely were not prepared for the crowd, which was weird since a concert was getting out! I forgot how long the wait was, but it was much longer than you'd expect since we ordered before they got slammed. Of course we expected some wait, but not around half an hour. The food court is a great option for something (hopefully) quicker than one of the sit down restaurants.
They said it's going to be 20 minutes for a slice of mushroom pizza. Waited 50 minutes. The pizza was good but the amount of time spent waiting for it is not worth it.

Did the job but nothing special. I've been to LV many times, so I'm well aware everything is extremely expensive, but I think this place is insanely overpriced. It is $8/slice, which to me is just crazy. Even San Francisco, amazing pizza is only $4 slice. We were hungry and just wanted to get some food in our stomaches, so we tried this. Wouldn't come back.

Tried it cause it said it was world famous pizza.
It took forever for just 1 slice of cheese pizza. I didn't care for it. 
I did like the sauce they used but that's it. I wouldn't have it again. But maybe that's just me.
